description:
A nice descent immediately after heavy rains. Perfect to combine with Hüttenwistobel when everything else has too much water (Hüttenwistobel in the morning, Schreustobel in the afternoon). Don't trust the water level you can see coming out from the canyon, due to sources, the canyon only has about 1/5 of the water level you can see down the road. Thus, your best reference would be Hüttenwistobel, if that one looks almost dry already, then Schreustobel is almost dry too, so better go for Panäratobel, Chrüzbach or Parlitobel in this case.

Approach

Go up the closest path south of the canyon until a height of about 1410m. There the map shows that there is no more path, but in reality there is, it will lead you immediately to the start of the canyon.

Descent

Nice pitches, sometimes you need to do 2 Waterfalls in one. A few safety exits on the way down.

Exit

Easy, walk down the riverbed.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background
name: Schreustobel
